intro: Brizopyrum ovatum, commonly known as the oval sedge, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically in clusters at the base of the plant. Brizopyrum ovatum is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, meadows, and along stream banks.
